casebody.data:
ALBERT W. STAHL v. THE UNITED STATES.

[Not reported in C. Cls. R.;

151 U. S. R., 366; 152 U. S. R., 384.] On the claimant's Appeal. Claimant entered the Naval Academy September 14, 1876, and graduated June 10, 1882; August 10, 1887, he resigned his commission as assistant engineer; August 11,1887, he was commissioned assistant naval constructor. He claims $1,000 for longevity pay as an assistant engineer in the Navy, from June 10, 1882, to August 10, 1887. The court below finds for the claimant for the fall amount. The decision of the court below is reversed on the same grounds as in the case of Alger, post. Mr. Justice Gray

delivered the opinion of the Supreme Court, January 22,1894.
